docs.snippet: The social network is ending Explore, an experiment in countries like Bolivia and Cambodia, where it had separated news and other publishers from its main site.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Experiment Ends as Fake News Rises
headline.main: Facebook to End News Feed Experiment in 6 Countries That Magnified Fake News

docs.snippet: As the social network’s list of woes grows, its 33-year-old founder, Mark Zuckerberg, will have to prove somehow he is not in way over his head.

headline.print_headline: Is It Time for More Adult Supervision at Facebook?
headline.main: Is It Time for More Adult Supervision at Facebook?

docs.snippet: New “hyperscale” data centers from the tech giants, part of a wave of global development, helped lead Prineville to a path of recovery.

headline.print_headline: An Oregon Mill Town Learns to Love Facebook and Apple
headline.main: An Oregon Mill Town Learns to Love Facebook and Apple

docs.snippet: Sri Lanka blocked access to the social network to help stem mob violence directed at its Muslim minority. Facebook said it was cooperating with the government.

headline.print_headline: Sri Lanka Blocks Facebook in Effort to Stem Violence
headline.main: In Sri Lanka, Facebook Contends With Shutdown After Mob Violence

docs.snippet: The campaign’s Florida staff unwittingly engaged with trolls. “Nobody reasonably would have asked — or even thought to ask — ‘Are you sure you’re not with Russia?’ ” an aide said.

headline.print_headline: How Russian Trolls Crept Into the Trump Campaign’s Facebook Messages
headline.main: How Russian Trolls Crept Into the Trump Campaign’s Facebook Messages

docs.snippet: Amazing technology that gives everyone a voice can also breed isolation and empower bullies.

headline.main: How Mark Zuckerberg Can Save Facebook — and Us

docs.snippet: Your interest in Kim Kardashian West can tell researchers how extroverted (very), how conscientious (more than most) and how open-minded (only somewhat) you are.

headline.main: How Researchers Learned to Use Facebook ‘Likes’ to Sway Your Thinking

docs.snippet: Former whiz kids who made their fortunes in the technology industry are now settling down, seemingly more attuned to the power they wield.

headline.print_headline: Whiz Kids Grow Up, for the Better
headline.main: The Young and Brash of Tech Grow a Bit Older, and Wiser

docs.snippet: A political data firm tied to the Trump campaign gained access to information on 50 million Facebook users. Here is how it happened, and the uproar it has caused.

headline.main: Facebook and Cambridge Analytica: What You Need to Know as Fallout Widens

docs.snippet: Advertisers, especially smaller ones, complain of inconsistency and gender bias in the process that determines whether images are rejected for being sexually suggestive.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Issue Laid Bare: Man’s Chest vs. Woman’s Back
headline.main: Facebook Lets Ads Bare a Man’s Chest. A Woman’s Back Is Another Matter.
